iterations.failure_reason: Rule hit but no new signatures
improvement_suggestions: Broaden the YARA pattern to allow for more variation in the surrounding instructions. This will reduce the likelihood of the pattern matching the same instruction sequence repeatedly.  Also, the skip offset needs to be adjusted to avoid the loop.  Because the `JZ` instruction is always taken, a skip offset that moves execution forward will only lead to the same pattern being matched again. It may be better to not skip at all and instead rely on subsequent patterns.

iterations.failure_reason: Rule hit but no new signatures
improvement_suggestions: Remove the `cape_options` entirely and allow the YARA rule to match the sequence of instructions directly.  Focus on identifying the core logic being obfuscated, rather than attempting to skip over specific instructions based on their addresses.  The `cape_options` are intended for very specific situations and are not a general-purpose bypass technique.

iterations.failure_reason: Rule hit but no new signatures
improvement_suggestions: Increase the `skip` offsets significantly. Try skipping over larger blocks of code, potentially including entire functions or loops.  This will force the execution to explore different parts of the code that might be obfuscated or otherwise hidden.  Also, consider removing the `count=0` from the cape options. It's likely limiting the number of times the bypass attempts to evolve the trace.
